tweet: As elected officials, we have no greater responsibility than protecting the US & welfare of the American people. Today my fellow members of the @NewDemCoalition's National Security Task Force and I released principles for a smart strategy for our country.   http://bit.ly/2Wv9ia5

I have unbroken confidence in our system of checks and balances and trust in our Constitution to guide us on the path ahead. I remain committed to following the truth and holding the President accountable under the law. 

Full statement: https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/schneider-statement-impeachment-inquiry-resolution …

Today’s vote outlines a path forward for the impeachment inquiry into President Trump’s misconduct, and ensures the next phase of the inquiry will involve open hearings for the American people to hear firsthand the facts of this case. #ImpeachmentResolution

May his memory be a blessing. https://twitter.com/HouseDemocrats/status/1187081298105516036 …

We are only as good as our word, which is why I just voted and the House overwhelmingly passed (354-60) a bipartisan, bicameral resolution opposing the President’s craven decision and calling for Turkey to immediately cease their military attacks in Syria.

I had a great Census Q&A last night in Prospect Heights. Our nation gets just one chance each decade to count its population, and it’s critical we get it right so that our community gets its fair share of funding for schools, hospitals, roads and more. #Census2020

President Trump is again sowing instability aat a time global leadership from the United States is desperately needed. Whether by design or incompetence, Russia and Iran stand to gain the most from this disastrous move.

The President’s impulsive decision to withdraw U.S. forces from positions in Syria and abandon our Kurdish allies will have disastrous repercussions. Making snap decisions without a coherent strategy weakens our foreign policy and threatens national security.
